isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Front Cover, Vibration Damper, and Gerotor Oil Pump - Cleaning, Inspection, and Testing - Gerotor Oil Pump

svcproc.title: Gerotor Oil Pump

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, wear safety glasses with side shields when using compressed air for cleaning to reduce the danger from flying debris. Limit the air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi). See "Safety Information."

svcproc.para: Wash all parts thoroughly in a suitable solvent. Dry with filtered compressed air.

step1.para: Lay front cover assembly on workbench.
Inspect gerotors and housing for nicks, burrs or scoring.

note.para: The inner and outer gerotors are a matched set and cannot be replaced individually.

item.para: When installing new gerotors, correct orientation is not required.
When installing old gerotors, correct orientation is required.

step1.para: Place inner and outer gerotors in oil pump housing.
Use a feeler gauge to inspect for wear by checking the radial clearance between outer gerotor and oil pump housing.
Check oil pump end clearance as follows:

step2.para: With the gerotors in place in the front cover, place straightedge across housing.
Insert feeler gauge under straightedge at inner and outer gerotors. Compare end clearance with specifications. See Specifications.
If measurements are not within specifications, replace both gerotors (as a set).

step1.para: Use a 12 mm internal hex wrench to remove oil pressure regulator.

Inspect oil pressure regulator piston poppet (steel) for binding / sticking due to debris or severe piston poppet scoring. Check for a broken oil pressure bypass spring. The spring should normally be the only potential cause of any malfunction in this assembly. Replace as necessary.
Check regulator bore (aluminum) for severe piston poppet scoring. It should not be expected to experience any significant dimensional wear. Refer to Specifications. Replace as necessary.
Install regulator components and tighten end cap to the Special Torque.
